research_list.name: Perplexity AI
research_list.market_position: Perplexity AI is an industry leader among AI-native search and conversational intelligence startups. As of late 2024 and 2025, its platform has demonstrated rapid adoption, boasting 22 million active users and $100 million+ in annualized revenue by early 2025. The company’s valuation increased explosively from $520 million in early 2024 to $9 billion by the end of the same year, and a $14 billion valuation after a major funding round in mid-2025. Perplexity outpaces most competitors in pure user growth and media attention and is carving a niche in enhanced, real-time AI-powered search. The company is backed by high-profile investors like Accel, former OpenAI and Google executives, and is widely covered as a challenger to traditional search (Google, Bing) and chat-based assistants.
research_list.future_outlook: Perplexity AI's future outlook is extremely strong, given massive demand for AI search and conversational assistants in consumer and enterprise sectors. Industry analysts project continued user growth and rapid revenue scaling into 2026. The AI search sector is at an inflection point, and Perplexity is well-positioned to capitalize on shifts in consumer habits away from legacy engines. Risks include intensifying competition from tech giants (Google, Microsoft), potential IP/legal concerns, and the need for sustained technical innovation. However, their relentless product development (“real-time” answers, web grounding, enterprise APIs), strong leadership, and investor momentum suggest a promising trajectory.
research_list.investment_potential: Perplexity AI presents high investment potential for early and growth-stage investors—demonstrable traction (ARR, users), network effects, robust funding, and strategic differentiation in a large addressable market. The company is not yet public, so access is limited to late-stage venture and growth rounds. Upside is substantial if Perplexity continues to scale, establishes defensible IP, and enters lucrative enterprise markets. Investors should weigh high-velocity expansion and brand position against competition and regulatory uncertainties. Overall, Perplexity is one of the most exciting AI investment stories of its cohort.

research_list.name: Cohere
research_list.market_position: Cohere is a leading provider of advanced natural language processing (NLP) infrastructure and models focused on secure, enterprise-grade AI. In 2025, Cohere reached a $7 billion valuation on the back of aggressive expansion into the enterprise SaaS and big data sector. The company’s ARR grew from $13 million in late 2023 to over $100 million by May 2025, expected to surpass $200 million by year-end. Industry partnerships (including with AMD, Meta), and focus on customizable, secure NLP models for business are unique advantages. In comparison to OpenAI, Cohere is recognized for its strengths in retrieval-augmented generation, reranking, multilingual support, and targeted business solutions, rather than consumer chatbots.
research_list.future_outlook: Cohere’s future looks robust, with continued growth projected as enterprises accelerate adoption of AI for data extraction, workflow automation, and next-generation search. With nearly $1 billion raised and new leaders joining from big tech, it is rapidly expanding internationally and innovating in enterprise-grade AI security and compliance. Analysts predict ongoing growth as businesses seek alternatives to US-based OpenAI, and governments and regulated industries seek control over data and AI deployments. Main risks include competitive pressures from established players like OpenAI and Google, rapid technological change, and the evolving AI regulation landscape. However, Cohere’s specialization and traction indicate long-term relevance.
research_list.investment_potential: Cohere is a high-potential, high-growth company, offering a strong investment case for VCs, late-stage private investors, and eventually, public market buyers. Its clear enterprise focus, fast revenue growth, high-caliber partnerships, and reputation for technical excellence support a bullish view. While not consumer-facing, Cohere’s infrastructure approach is critical to the AI stack of the next decade. Large strategic investors or corporate venture arms may find unique synergies. Key investment considerations are fast-changing competitive dynamics and policy risks but, overall, Cohere ranks at the top of AI infrastructure bets globally.

research_list.name: Supabase
research_list.market_position: Supabase is recognized as the breakout open-source alternative to Google Firebase, specializing in backend-as-a-service platforms for developers. By 2025, Supabase's revenue soared to $70 million (from ~$15 million in 2024) and its developer base grew from 1 million to over 4.5 million in less than twelve months. Valuation followed: Supabase raised a $100 million Series E round at a $5 billion valuation in October 2025, after hitting $2 billion just four months prior. Its rapid growth stems from technical strengths—an open, scalable platform built on PostgreSQL, broad API support, and a strong self-hosted option. Supabase is widely deployed among startups and SMEs, as backend infrastructure for web and AI applications.
research_list.future_outlook: Supabase’s outlook remains extremely positive, as demand for scalable, open-source backend and data infrastructure accelerates. It serves as a trusted developer tool for both AI/ML workloads and traditional app development. The expansion of its product suite, robust developer evangelism, impressive GitHub star growth, and ongoing funding position Supabase to become a foundational layer in next-generation cloud architecture. Potential threats include competition from hyperscale cloud providers and younger backend platforms, as well as the need to continually evolve capabilities in a fast-moving sector. However, market adoption and momentum are strong indicators of sustained relevance.
research_list.investment_potential: Supabase represents a compelling investment for growth-oriented VC and technology investors, with late-stage venture rounds oversubscribed. Its ARR multiple, developer traction, and viral adoption among tech companies and solo developers support significant upside. It appeals particularly to investors who believe in the enduring growth of the open-source and developer-tool ecosystem. While not risk-free, its sticky user base, proven monetization, and rapid scaling make Supabase one of the hottest cloud software investment opportunities globally in 2024-2025.
